N.Y. Comp. Codes R. & Regs. Tit. 18 ยง 627.2 - Conditions for reimbursement for child support enforcement

State Regulations
(a) No portion of
any claim for reimbursement for child support enforcement activities submitted
by a social services district may be supported solely with State funds if
reimbursement may be claimed from a program for which Federal participation is
available. (b) Any claims for
reimbursement from any portion of a program or activity for which Federal
financial participation is available which were not fully reimbursed as
claimed, and which were properly made at the time they were originally claimed, may be claimed from programs for which Federal participation is available if
they could have been so claimed when originally submitted, provided that the
revised claim is timely and an adjustment made to reduce the original claim is
simultaneously submitted to the department. (c) Any claims for reimbursement for child
support enforcement expenditures which are subsequently determined by the
department to be reimbursable from, or for which reimbursement is actually
received or credited from, another program for which Federal financial
participation could be received, shall be reduced in an amount equivalent to
the amount determined by the department to be due as a result of the
availability of Federal participation. (d) Claims for reimbursement for child
support enforcement expenditures shall not be submitted if such claims seek
reimbursement at rates or amounts that are greater than otherwise permitted by
the department. (e) Any adjustments
of claims for reimbursement in the child support enforcement program, including
adjustments to claims as a result of recoveries, collections or incentives, shall be made in accordance with procedures, instructions or directions of the
department. Notes
